subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... I believe Elliote wants to minimize the public API to make it easier to use. Martin Fowler has a nice article on using interfaces to achieve the same
messageBody:
Shane Mingins wrote:
> On 9/2/05, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
>>one class. Public API should be kept to a minimum, especially if you
>>expect anybody to use your API. If the API is purely for your app's own
>

> If using TDD you are slowly emerging the design. Why would Extract Class
> not be a valid refactoring? At some point a private method on a class wants
> to be a class in it's own. Am I missing something?
> Cheers
> Shane
>

I believe Elliote wants to minimize the public API to make it easier to
use. Martin Fowler has a nice article on using interfaces to achieve the
same objective.

Summary :
http://www.martinfowler.com/bliki/PublishedInterface.html

Full article :
http://martinfowler.com/ieeeSoftware/published.pdf

Kevin
